response.answer_text: Apple could in theory buy all of Samsung’s stock which is buying Samsung (although as a practical matter this tends to drive prices up so that isn’t really how it is normally done). However that is the financial side. Legally large companies tend to have to show they aren’t creating an anti-competitive environment. Like in the USA car companies are generally not allowed to buy each other, but if one were going bankrupt another would probably be allowed to buy the ashes. Here Apple would need to convince the US and South Korean government that buying Samsung won’t reduce the competition in say mobile phones. They might be allowed to slice off the phone part of either company and sell it. Governments may also have lanes against foreign ownership that might apply. Governments tend to have laws about strategic sectors. Airplanes, steel, large scale manufacturing. Apple doesn’t fall into this, but Samsung may. Then you hit the “are the business and cultures compatible enough to merge” question. I would say Apple recently hated Samsung’s guts, viewed them as dishonest, and cared enough about those things to go to court even though it forced Apple to disclose a lot of secrets during the trial. Samsung may or may not deserve it, but Apple has a deep dislike and distrust of Samsung. So I think the two cultures are incompatible. The businesses may also be as Samsung makes everything from chips to heavy trucks while Apple’s entire product line fits on on modest sized table. So can they? Not in any meaningful or useful way.

Could Apple acquire Samsung? Doubtful. The best they could do is probably a merger due to Samsung’s size. Does Apple have any interest in acquiring or merging with Samsung? Absolutely not. Apple has no interest in having a business with such a different corporate culture that is that diversified.

Most likely, Apple could not afford to buy http://Samsung.Us Also, Apple does not want to sell washer, dryers, refrigerators, oil exploration ships, insurance, build office buildings and apartment complexes, food courts in malls and the dozens of other things Samsung does.
